lead_paragraph: HEDGE FUND MANAGERS HEADED FOR DIVORCE | For a decade, Kenneth C. Griffin and his wife, Anne Dias Griffin, were a financial powerhouse, two hedge fund managers who captivated the Chicago social scene, Michael J. de la Merced and Alexandra Stevenson write in DealBook. But on Wednesday, Mr. Griffin, the head of the $20 billion investment firm Citadel, filed a divorce petition in Cook County, Ill., citing “irreconcilable differences” after 11 years of marriage. Ms. Dias Griffin has fired back publicly, claiming to have been blindsided by the move. Now, the domestic dispute threatens to push the private couple into the spotlight.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Hedge Fund Managers Headed for Divorce
